attributes.action: AWARD THE MILITARY CROSS POSTHUMOUSLY TO WALTER TULL. THE FIRST COLOURED MAN TO BE AWARDED A COMMISSION IN THE BRITISH ARMY.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Walter Tull was a professional footballer who, at the outbreak of WW1 joined the Army.  Because of his leadership qualities he was recommended for a commission.  He became the first coloured man to be awarded a commission in the British Army.  Just before he was kia he was recommended for the Military Cross but was never awarded it.  

I would suggest that this be awarded to him posthumously.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Ministry of Defence.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
